brief_title: Telavancin for Treatment of Uncomplicated Staphylococcus Aureus Bacteremia
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether telavancin (TD-6424, ARBELIC) can be safety administered to patients with bloodstream infections and whether telavancin is effective in treating these infections.
description: Telavancin 10mg/kg/day IV every 24 hrs for up to 14 days
Vancomycin 1 Gram every 12 hr IV (intravenously) OR nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin 2 Grams every 6 hr IV (intravenously) for up to 14 days.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria - Documented S. aureus bacteremia Exclusion Criteria - Patients who had received or would have received more than 72 hours of potentially effective systemic antistaphylococcal therapy within 7 days prior to randomization. The following agents were considered potentially effective antistaphylococcal therapy: antistaphylococcal penicillins (including nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin), cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, glycopeptides (including vancomycin and teicoplanin) and linezolid
